q: Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.
h:
“Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The best fighter is never angry.
h:
“The best fighter is never angry.” —
Lao Tzu

q: We need never be ashamed of our tears.
h:
“We need never be ashamed of our tears.” —
Charles Dickens

q: The final mystery is oneself.
h:
“The final mystery is oneself.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience.
h:
“The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience.” —
Mark Manson

q: We meet ourselves time and again in a thousand disguises on the path of life.
h:
“We meet ourselves time and again in a thousand disguises on the path of life.” —
Carl Jung

q: Everyday you can take a tiny step in the right direction.
h:
“Everyday you can take a tiny step in the right direction.” —
Unknown

q: If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.
h:
“If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.
h:
“Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: If you can't imagine it, you can't have it.
h:
“If you can't imagine it, you can't have it.” —
Toni Morrison

q: Patience is not the ability to wait but the ability to keep a good attitude while waiting.
h:
“Patience is not the ability to wait but the ability to keep a good attitude while waiting.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: Life begins where fear ends.
h:
“Life begins where fear ends.” —
Osho

q: It's easy to wish for health when you're sick.  When you're doing well, you need just as much vigilance.
h:
“It's easy to wish for health when you're sick. When you're doing well, you need just as much vigilance.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Behind every cloud is another cloud.
h:
“Behind every cloud is another cloud.” —
Judy Garland

q: Ideas do not reach perfection in a day, no matter how much study is put upon them.
h:
“Ideas do not reach perfection in a day, no matter how much study is put upon them.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: To earn more you must learn more.
h:
“To earn more you must learn more.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Don't stumble over something that's behind you.
h:
“Don't stumble over something that's behind you.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.
h:
“Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.” —
Unknown

q: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
h:
“No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.” —
Alan Watts

q: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.
h:
“It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice.
h:
“Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice. ” —
Henry Ford

q: A different result requires doing something different.
h:
“A different result requires doing something different.” —
Gary Keller

q: Time you enjoy wasting, was not wasted.
h:
“Time you enjoy wasting, was not wasted.” —
John Lennon

q: Why change? Everyone has his own style. When you have found it, you should stick to it.
h:
“Why change? Everyone has his own style. When you have found it, you should stick to it.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: The real measure of your wealth is how much you'd be worth if you lost all your money.
h:
“The real measure of your wealth is how much you'd be worth if you lost all your money.” —
Unknown

q: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.
h:
“There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.” —
Mark Twain

q: Extraordinary results happen only when you give the best you have to become the best you can be at your most important work.
h:
“Extraordinary results happen only when you give the best you have to become the best you can be at your most important work.” —
Gary Keller

q: Do what is right, not what is easy, nor what is popular.
h:
“Do what is right, not what is easy, nor what is popular.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines practiced every day.
h:
“Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines practiced every day.” —
Jim Rohn

q: One mistake does not have to rule a person's entire life.
h:
“One mistake does not have to rule a person's entire life.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: There are two kinds of perfect people: those who are dead, and those who have not been born yet.
h:
“There are two kinds of perfect people: those who are dead, and those who have not been born yet.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: A goal is a dream with a deadline.
h:
“A goal is a dream with a deadline.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess.
h:
“No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess. ” —
Isaac Newton

q: Your success and happiness lie in you.
h:
“Your success and happiness lie in you.” —
Helen Keller

q: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
h:
“Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.
h:
“Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.
h:
“Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.” —
Dalai Lama

q: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
h:
“If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.” —
Albert Einstein

q: If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.
h:
“If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.” —
Alexander Pope

q: If you try to micromanage yourself all you're going to do is make yourself miserable.
h:
“If you try to micromanage yourself all you're going to do is make yourself miserable.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.
h:
“The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.” —
James Allen
